task_prefix: A synthetic dataset designed to model the relationship between climate change variables and agricultural economic impacts. The dataset simulates real-world patterns of how climate variations affect agricultural productivity and resulting economic consequences across different regions and farming conditions. Each example contains 15 features. Predict the Economic_Impact_Million_USD.

column_descriptions.Temperature_Change: Average temperature deviation from historical baseline in degrees Celsius
column_descriptions.Precipitation_Change: Percentage change in annual precipitation compared to historical average
column_descriptions.Extreme_Weather_Events: Number of extreme weather events (droughts, floods, storms) per year
column_descriptions.Soil_Quality_Index: Composite measure of soil health including organic content, pH, and nutrient levels
column_descriptions.Crop_Diversity_Index: Measure of agricultural biodiversity in the region
column_descriptions.Irrigation_Access: Percentage of agricultural land with irrigation access
column_descriptions.Technology_Adoption_Level: Index of modern agricultural technology implementation
column_descriptions.Farm_Size_Hectares: Average size of farming operations in the region
column_descriptions.Growing_Season_Length: Number of days suitable for crop growth annually
column_descriptions.Market_Access_Score: Measure of farmers' ability to reach markets and sell produce
column_descriptions.Farmer_Education_Level: Average years of formal education among farmers
column_descriptions.Adaptation_Investment: Annual investment in climate adaptation measures
column_descriptions.Insurance_Coverage: Percentage of farms with climate-related insurance
column_descriptions.Previous_Year_Impact: Economic impact from climate events in previous year

class_description: Target: Economic_Impact_Million_USD - Projected economic impact of climate change on agricultural production. Units: Millions of US Dollars. Range: Likely negative to positive values, representing losses and gains
